review_title: Enjoyable experience pursuing my own research
job_title: Undergraduate Researcher in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I had the ability to make my own schedule to pursue my own research topics and I had fantastic guidance from my advisors as I needed.
cons: I think there was too much structure overall in the program. I wanted to spend my time doing my own work but I had to attend several mandatory meetings and other events that put unnecessary strain on my schedule.

cons: Severely short-staffed, leading to high rates of burnout and turnover. Compensation is inadequate given the high cost of living in LA. No clear career advancement opportunities.

review_title: Has been fantastic to work at during college

job_title: Lifeguard in Los Angeles, CA
pros: With consistent hours that can work with your class schedule and a majority adult clientele, this is a very chill job that's absolutely worth getting certified for.
cons: Working in the sun can be really tough in Los Angeles, and it's rare to get more than 5 hours a week given the pool schedule.

job_title: Director in Long Beach, CA
pros: Great staff and personnel. But their voices need to be heard by the Senior Administration.
cons: Back in 2014-2020, you can only advance in Oxy if you are with the New School mafia. The previous president from the New School hired his own set of people from the New School, and literally made their own little empire at Oxy. So many staff left Oxy because of this. They lost their voices at Oxy. Now that that New School president left in 2020, I am hoping things will be better at Oxy, though there are still 3 people at the top with very very fat salaries running the school. Hopefully the new President from Stanford has his eyes wide open.

job_title: Lifeguard in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great fit with classes, you can get a tan, don’t have to worry about tons of kids at the pool.
cons: VERY limited hours. This is a side hustle at best.

job_title: Financial Aid in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Amazing place to work. Miss it a lot.

job_title: Director in Los Angeles, CA

Beautiful place to work

review_title: Great campus culture and a progressive work environment.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Oxy is a great community with friendly people and beautiful grounds. Because the campus is relatively small, it's easy to know everyone and everyone knows you. Employees and faculty genuinely care about making the campus a better place.
cons: Very low pay. Oxy underpays most positions, as is true with many higher education institutions. This used to be balanced with excellent benefits, but during my nine years I saw many of the benefits disappear with a president focusing on the bottom line. There are still great benefits, just not as many as there used to be. Your experience may different greatly depending on your department; some are better than others. Also, many long-time employees have recently lost their jobs due to restructuring and budgeting, which has contributed to a culture of fear and a  more corporate-like atmosphere.

review_title: Small school - for all that means
job_title: Assistant Director (Non-Academic) in Los Angeles, CA
pros: You will get student contact and lots of it if that's what you want. You have an opportunity to participate in a wide range of activities as a professional and collaborate across functional areas as much as you can imagine. Things can change quickly on campus because of the small nature of the organization.
cons: Because of a slim staffing structure in many areas, folks are stretched thin. This makes for a somewhat jaded workforce. Since you are given so many opportunities across functional areas, it may be difficult to focus on your actual job. In some areas of campus, pay is not comparable to the work that is done as many sets of job responsibilities have been combined into one position.

job_title: Resident Advisor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: The department makes an effort to compensate its student workers fairly. I acknowledge it must be difficult to make a decision that is fair for all, as the RA compensation affects the financial aid package of most of student employees. I really got to know the campus geography and personnel well through this job. It is also a great way to get to know people you otherwise wouldn't.
cons: The programming requirements are inconsistent (change every 6 - 12 months) and in general are too much to do and still succeed with school work. I did encounter some dismissal of RA ideas by upper management.

review_title: Great School Despite What the News Says, But It's Still Higher Ed
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
The students are incredibly intelligent and the best part of working here. They are feisty but it keeps things interesting. 
The administration isn't as wonky as other colleges I've worked at, but there are a few characters.
cons:
It's higher ed so the same old problems persist here. Faculty reign supreme and go a bit crazy sometimes.
Pay isn't what it should be, especially for admin staff.

job_title: Information Resource Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great opportunities to take charge. Excellent work environment - very nice and friendly people. Potlucks, holiday lunches/breakfasts occasionally. You get paid for the work you put in and very understanding if you needed time off. Lastly, ample training involved so you never felt you were thrown into the deep end without guidance.
cons: Really no negatives at this job in terms of work environment or company values. They definitely appreciate their employees and everyone is very nice.

review_title: Very pleasant, collegial work environment. Interesting and intelligent staff and students.
job_title: Library Supervisor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Very pleasant, collegial work environment.  Interesting and intelligent staff and students.  High-level technology, systems and facilities.  Access to campus facilities (fitness center, dining services, theater, etc.) and activities (reading groups, lectures, choir, etc.)
cons: Training was adequate, but could be greater emphasis on employee development.  Because of the relatively small size of the college, and the general satisfaction/loyalty of staff, there is low staff turnover, and thus not many options for movement/growth within the organization.

job_title: Hameetman Career Center in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Every department except the Hameetman Career Center (HCC)  is great.
cons:
THIS IS NOT AN ANGRY EMPLOYEE POST- THIS IS REAL. AVOID ANY POSITIONS IN THIS DEPARTMENT.

Most abusive work environment WE (the staff) ever encountered. Other departments seem friendly and supportive and they're committed to holding on to good employees for years, but the "leader" of the Hameetman Career Center regularly harasses her staff by yelling at them in front of groups, students, and visitors. She has no direction and very limited experience, VERY HIGH TURNOVER RATE in only this department, always under HR investigation, she's been there for two years and there is not a single person in the department who was there when she started because they all quit because of her, she is incredibly incompetent and needs to bully and intimidate her staff in a desperate attempt to hide it. The college recently held an employee appreciate event, every department leader was present, except for the "leader" of the Hameetman Career Center and every department has some type of recognition except the the career center. 

She is  micromanager which is tough to handle since she is poorly informed on many subjects.

She is focused control and nothing else. Constantly making new demands or new ridiculous policies that are focused on behavior, dress code, time off, or work hours, despite the fact that there are no staff issues with any of these topics. 

Most current staff members are seeking employment elsewhere. 

On several occasions, the "leader" of the HCC informed all of her staff that she doesn't care if they quit or find employment elsewhere, claiming that "I'm a recruiter and I'll just find someone new" yet there has been many positions that she is incapable of filling. 

The rest of the college is great, but not here. She will pretend she is nice in the interview process and find something to yell at your for on your first day. 

If you are looking for a position with no growth, constant abuse, constant pointless meetings that usually involve you just sitting there watching the "leader" slowly type or not know how to work technology then this is the perfect place for you.

job_title: in Cowan Heights, CA
pros:
Occidental College is a wonderful place to work. 
The management is excellent, your coworkers are friendly and the campus is completely beautiful! 
I had an awesome experience and would recommend working at Occidental College to my friends and family.

Another plus--Eagle Rock is a super cool little neighborhood with lots of great restaurants!
cons: There were no cons that I can think of. No complaints here!

job_title: Digital Scholar in Los Angeles, CA
pros: You can set up your own hours. Very flexible and ability to lead your own projects. Leadership is awesome.
cons: There aren't really any cons. Sometimes it is hard to start projects because of time constraints, but it is a liberating space for critical making and entrepreneurship. I wish more people would use the space.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Good benefits- health, savings plan, vacation. Able to attend many professional conferences. Fun parties for staff. Great co-workers. Stimulating, academic environment. Free parking and gym. Beautiful trees and areas to take breaks. Great places to eat nearby. Professionall growth encouraged and supported with time off.
cons: Training on the job was minimal. I was experienced so not a problem for me. No levels for advancement. Very low staffing but everyone is willing to help and pitch in.

review_title: Great Students/ So many tasks for one position with student workers
job_title: Laboratory Director in Los Angeles, CA
pros:
It is so nice to provide service to great students.
Before Covid, they had a good retirement plan.
cons:
So many tasks for one position.
Hard to manage and get done working with so many student workers (2-5hours/week) help.
Changed to not good health care provider (Health net -> Blue Shield of California).

review_title: It was the kind of job that I would of liked to of stayed at.
job_title: Grounds Maintenance Worker in Eagle Rock, CA
pros: Nice salary. great people to work and learn from. plus the campus is Beautiful. and best of all I lived rite around the corner.
cons: this was the one place that I honestly had no complaints about...

job_title: Grader in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Easy system grading for Dr. J. He's very reasonable and it was use grading as a form of review.
cons: Around finals there were very strict deadlines. The homework had to be turned around in about two days, which interfered with studying.

job_title: in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Great work environment with friendly staff and administration. The students on campus are also very easy going and look to strike up conversation whenever possible.
cons: The school operates in a bubble that is Eagle Rock, Los Angeles, don't let that keep you from exploring all the great things about the surrounding neighborhoods like Highland Park.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Fantastic office to work in, one of the best on campus.  Great pay as well for the work we were asked to do.
cons: The institution can sometime be bureaucratic.  There is a disconnect between students and administration.

job_title: Program Assistant in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Lots of good perks including gym access as well as other simple things that make it a lot better. The students are extremely nice.
cons: Administration is shoddy and seem to not be very well connected not sure if they actually know this though.

job_title: Medical Office Administrator in Glendale, CA
pros: Wonderful staff, family atmosphere, and great team work.
cons: I did not find any real cons.

job_title: in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great employees. Most have been there for 15+ years.
cons: Administration doesn't listen to staff. Too controlling in matters they don't need to be in.

review_title: Good time as work study employee
